document.masterDocTitle: Taxonomy of the genus Tantunema Siddiqi, 1982 (Dorylaimida: Tylencholaimidae) with description of one new and two known species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Taxonomy of the genus Tantunema Siddiqi, 1982 (Dorylaimida: Tylencholaimidae) with description of one new and two known species

subSubSection.paragraph:
Tylencholaiminae .
Very small nematodes,
0.3 â€“ 0.6 mm
long. Cuticle tylencholaimoid; outer cuticle smooth, inner layer barely with distinct radial refractive elements. Lip region cap-like, slightly offset, with amalgamated lips; weak post-labial sclerotization often present. Amphids small, their aperture pore-like or short transverse slit. Odontostyle short and thin. Odontophore rod-like with slight basal thickening. Anterior portion of the pharynx weakly muscular, extending gradually or abruptly into the basal expansion, which occupies about two-fifths of total neck length. Female genital system mono-opisthodelphic, anterior branch completely absent. Vulva transverse. Female tail rounded to subcylindrical. Male not known.
